DBD could be a decent game if the developers cared about its gameplay. The idea is amazing, it has a very unique art style. The soundtrack is badass. But so far the game is overall awful, it is very unlikely you'll have fun playing it, if you are an adequate person. If you want to have fun, this game doesn't fit. 

The game is terrible to play both as a killer and a survivor. A killer can just take a powerful perk/addon and win the game without much effort. Playing as a killer is boring and if you enjoy it, you're a person trying to self-esteem. Playing as a survivor is frustrating and if you enjoy it, you're a masochist. 

The game technically has legal cheats and even encourages using them. For instance, Huntress can take a one-shot hatchets addon and if a survivor makes even a small mistake, the game is lost. Survivors don't have something like this. There are so few decent builds for survivors, everything else is useless. And even with these builds survivors are extremely weak.
 
The rank system is terrible, it just doesn't work. Rank resets even make it worse. The only way you can play it relatively fine is to find 4 friends and always play with them, but it can be fun only at first. If you run into a killer who has taken powerful perks, addons and memento mori, I swear you lose. 

Every update breaks the balance more and more. I don't understand what the developers try to do. The only thing they do about it is adding new killers from either movies/games, or creating their own just to gain the hype as well as adding new mechanics that make playing as a killer easier.

Bugs and glitches is another flaw. They're everywhere and if you tell me you never ran into them, you didn't play the game. There are minor bugs, but there are gamebreaking bugs as well. For example, hitboxes in this game is probably the most annoying thing, they are absolutely unpredictable and unstable. You can get hit 5 meters from a killer. You can run into bugs even in the main menu! 

The community in this game is probably the most toxic one ever. Even your teammates try to humiliate you. You are very likely to have a caustic conversation in the chat after the end of the match.

To conclude, this game is fun only for a certain contingent, who enjoy either humiliate others, or suffer. If you are one of those, this game is for you.

TL;DR game is buggy, gameplay decent, community filled with sore losers, lots of paywalls, for now survivor sided (fluctuates), fun at start gets worse with time.

Killer Pros:
-You get to play the most active side of the game.
-Killers are quite different from each other and each has its own skill ceiling hence replayability.
-You ideally get the most blood points games currency (but not guaranteed)
-At the time of writing, insanely short queue times, as compared to 1 year ago (used to wait up to 30 min)

Killer Cons:
-LOTS of bugs that end up losing you the game the one that happens the most right now is "fake" hits that consist of you hitting the survivor getting all the feedback that you did (visual and audio) but instead not getting it, leading to confusion and precious time lost, happens when interacting with pallets, windows, and the perk dead hard which all mess with the players position.
-After your first 4-5 "wins" you get pitted against the highest rank survivors (MMR is broken)
-If you don't play meta perks or strong addons most of the times you lose drastically.
-Playing certain killers is seen as bad by some survivors (Ex Nurse/Spirit) 
-Playing certain perks is seen as bad by some survivors (Ex NOED)
-Playing certain addons is seen as bad by some survivors (Ex Iri. Hatchets)
-Those mentioned before will usually lead to lots of flaming, and being called names.
-If you DO NOT do those you get bullied by the survivors into oblivion, hence it's either play by the "survivor rule book" or get slammed for it. 
-Getting weaker update by update, although the upcoming killer at the moment looks very powerful so far
-More on the niche side, but you are playing first person so you don't get to see your own cosmetics except the weapon and your hands.
-As you progress it gets more and more stressful, and missions/achievements become harder if not impossible to achieve.

Survivor Pros:
-You have 3 teammates to work with.
-Easier straight forward gameplay.
-Extremely strong perks, AND many to chose from.
-Most items provide a huge boost in performance.
-A lot of blood points, and less hassle to get them. 
-You get to play with friends.
-Getting more powerful update by update.
-You get to bully the big scary person.
-You see yourself and your cosmetics.

Survivor Cons:
-You have 3 teammates to work with
-You can get focused or camped which takes away from the fun, and wastes your time but can be fixed with 1 perk (Borrowed time / decisive strike, and more)
-Stomped at the beginning.
-A single skill ceiling which mostly consists of keeping the killer busy or pressing a button when the indicator tells you to.
-Considered boring gameplay if you do not engage the killer. (pressing M1 for ~80 seconds per generator usually less)
A really good game. Only problem that i find with this game is that I find that I it hard to get a game as a killer. As a survivor though I get a game almost instantly.

17年9月入坑 2200小时的玩家 版本更新把游戏从原来的人类皮到死到现在5分钟的速修开门走 虽然很多游戏机制都变了 但是游戏还是能玩的 人屠博弈是游戏最大的乐趣 另外能溜屠夫多久和能不能四杀并不能说明自己技术的好坏 地图、地形、板窗的刷新对双方都有优势或者劣势 自己的一次失误有可能葬送己方的节奏 同等水平的人屠 走地屠夫和幻神有非常大的差距 不要抱怨哪个屠夫强哪个屠夫弱 如果改的没法玩了哪怎么还有这么多人玩  游戏玩法千变万化 按照自己的意愿来 所谓做人留一线日后好相见 游戏圈子小 多考虑下别人 游戏特色BUG特别多 排队时间有时会很久 慢慢习惯
除了屠夫拔插和队友故意卡位 其他的不要责怪别人 多想想自己的水平 失误在哪里 下次要注意
最后 感谢还在坚持的主播们还有佛系人屠们

Cons

The game incentives buying only cash characters to get some perks.
Example: Make Your Choice, Decisive Strike etc.

The game is very grindy to encourage players to spending $$. I played hours and only have 1k ingame currency. Think it takes about 9k to buy a new character.
Long wait times
on 06/30/2019 its still peer to peer (they say servers are coming in the summer of 2019)

Fix: 
1:give players the ability to get paid character perks outside of buying them.
2: reduce the entry price to new characters.

Pros
You can see everything (unlike Deciet)
A lot of fun with friends 
If you are looking for that fear then yes this is the perfect game that might scratch that itch.

Conclusion: if you are looking to play with friends or need some time to burn then yeah this might be the game for you, I liked it and i would recommend it BUT this game needs to fix its monetization policy. You can argue that this game is pay to win but I liked playing it so i am recommending it.

This game is extremely frustrating because it is mainly balanced around the Survive With Friends game mode. Solo queuing into a match is basically ensuring that you will not survive because most teams who solo queue are poorly coordinated. Most of the killers are very powerful against these types of matches because they are built to balance against teams of friends who have discord or some other means of voice chat. If you want to play as killer, then be prepared to wait a long while to load into a match. Really. A while. Also be prepared for a survive with friends group to completely upend your plans of killing them by using their flashlights, matching perk sets, or blocking hooks, etc. You will find that there are a few killers that high ranking players tend to favor because they are more overpowered than other killers. Most of these killers have a high mobility rate, such as chainsaw running, or teleporting, which give them a larger amount of control on the maps. The ranking system is also very frustrating ever since the developers decided to "fix" the problems with it. So it is much harder to maintain your rank and especially gain higher rank in this game. I have finally had enough of the bad hit boxes, laggy connections, and the horribly mannered players of this game. And it is my greatest hope that this game will soon see its demise. I hope that this review was helpful.

Edit: I still stand by this review years and hundreds of hours later. This game is just getting worse to play with every update.

Update Q1 2021:
BHVR became more and more complacent. They do the bare minimum (a generous statement at best) to keep the game functional. They don't listen to their player base and treat them like idiot. The devs no longer even try to create special events for holidays. The past few chapters, the Blight and the Twin, were terrible, and they even released a half-baked killer with unfinished mechanics. At this point, the devs aren't blind; they just don't care.
